meanings.definition: To make sour or bitter in taste.
meanings.sent1: Adding too much lemon juice can acerbate the salad.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar will acerbate the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected addition of vinegar acerbated the taste of the cake.
meanings.sent4: His sarcastic comments acerbated the already tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of the medicine acerbated my discomfort.

meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints acerbate her friends.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site acerbated the residents.
meanings.sent3: The persistent buzzing of the fly acerbated my patience.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet acerbated his headache.
meanings.sent5: The teasing remarks acerbated her mood.
